web.title: Project B Demo
web.line:
This is a very quick little demo of the Passage foundation class. Passage provides classes like Verse, VerseRange, Passage (which is a collection of Verses), and Book (a utility class that can tell you how many verses there are in a chapter, and so on).
You can get a good example of it's work here. Try typing "gen 1 1" into the text box (and press return) The applet will parse the text display a message to show that it has understood (or not as the case may be) and re-write the reference to a more standard form (in this case "Gen 1:1")
The applet will work with some quite complex references (for example "Mat 3:5-8,10", "Rev 22", "Jude 6", "1 Ti3 16-2Ti 1:$", "Exo 1:5,4,3", "Luk 1:1-80", "Psa 1:1-$:$") Please tell me if you get any surprises:
I'm afraid that I don't have a copy of Netscape to hand so I have no idea if it will work in Netscape. IE4 is fine.
Passage Test Applet (requires JDK1.1 compliant browser)
